nodes.bodyText: you should not be using the protocol handler here. Instead, you need to introduce a method to upload the segment to contrller vip. Copy/paste protocolHandler.uploadSegment. Refactor the protocol handler to use this method.
Done the refactoring. Please take a look.
You dont need this class. If return values turn out to be more complex, we can introduce a status class then

nodes.bodyText: Why does this throw URISyntax exception? We are providing a File handle, it does not seem correct to let the upper layer handle the URI syntax failure. The uploader, when constructed, should verify the URIs right?

Maybe call it Server2ControllerSegmentUploader? I think we should omit Vip in the name, there is nothing in here that says we should go through vip

Done.
I looked up the code, and it seems that we sanitize the url returned by the controller, but then we pass strings around. We need to clean this up, but it can be in a later PR.
